programme.title: Space Channel AFTER DARK
programme.desc: When the sun goes down, Space Channel turns on as the Universe comes alive in a melodic mixtape curated for night owls. Duration: 14400

programme.title: Space Channel News
programme.desc: The latest news from Space Channel Global HQ Duration: 3483

programme.title: Space Channel News
programme.desc: From commercial space stations to water on the Moon, there's a lot happening in space and we follow the stories that have real meaning on the ground. Duration: 2980

programme.title: New Lunar Rovers
programme.desc: Saudi Arabia and Russia begin training astronauts, 3D printed rocket parts are now becoming reality, and General Motors and Lockheed Martin have just partnered to create an Artemis era Lunar Rover. Duration: 240

programme.title: New Space Race - Asia update
programme.desc: While the commercialization of space begins to flourish, the militarization of LEO and beyond is accelerating exponentially. Multiple Asian countries are now strengthening their presence in space. Duration: 294

programme.title: Latest News - China Starlink update
programme.desc: As commercial and government space programs continue to overlap, China seems particularly worried about SpaceX. According to China Military Online, an official website linked to China’s Central Military Commission, Elon Musk’s SpaceX might be used by the “hegemony-obsessed US” to dominate space and bring “chaos or calamity” to the world. Duration: 271

programme.title: TrailerPalooza
programme.desc: Our favorite space movies from the big screen to streaming, must see films for your inner space nerd. Duration: 3600

programme.desc: Join us as we travel through the Space Channel Universe and experience the Final Frontier like never before. Duration: 5400

programme.title: Space Channel News Special-Space Force Automation Spectrum
programme.desc: Aaron's research deals with human decision making when paired with Artificial Intelligence, autonomous systems, or other types of artificial systems. Specifically, research questions revolve around advisor trust using human confidence as an implicit measure of advisor trust when receiving advice or working in a human-machine team. In other words, my research aims to uncover methods to maximize appropriate human-machine interaction. Other areas of interest include the effects of anthropomorphism, algorithmic expressions of confidence, user cognitive load, user affective states, and other dispositional traits of the user on human advice seeking and use. Duration: 1800
